meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the time before modernity.
meanings.sent1: The promodern artifacts in the museum fascinated the visitors.
meanings.sent2: Her promodern dress stood out among the sleek, modern designs.
meanings.sent3: The promodern clock refused to tick, preferring to stay frozen in time.
meanings.sent4: His promodern mindset was a bridge to the past, connecting generations.
meanings.sent5: The promodern architecture of the building reflected a bygone era.

meanings.definition: Favoring or advocating for traditional values or practices over modern ones.
meanings.sent1: The promodern community celebrated ancient customs with joy.
meanings.sent2: She held a promodern belief that handwritten letters were more sincere than emails.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa's promodern insistence on using a typewriter made the family chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The promodern approach to farming embraced age-old techniques with pride.
meanings.sent5: Their promodern lifestyle rejected technology in favor of simplicity.
